{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Alan Brough | image = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1967}} | birth_place = Hawera, New Zealand | residence = Melbourne, Australia | known_for = ''[[The Craic]]'', ''[[The Nugget]]'' and ''[[Spicks and Specks (TV series)|Spicks and Specks]]'' | education = | occupation = Comedian
Television presenter
Author
Radio host | salary = | networth = | spouse = | website = }} '''Alan Brough''' (born in [[Hawera]], New Zealand in 1967){{cite web| last=Lallo|first= Michael |title=Hey, Brough |url= http://www.smh.com.au/news/tv--radio/hey-brough/2007/02/25/1172338459290.html |work= Sydney Morning Herald | publisher=Fairfax | date=26 February 2007 |accessdate=22 November 2013 }} is a New Zealand-born actor, television and radio host and comedian based in Australia. ==Career== ===Early life=== Brough worked as an actor in [[Wellington]] and [[Auckland]], mainly in live theatre. He also appeared in a series of butter commercials as a drag queen called Marge. In 1993, Brough appeared in the New Zealand sitcom ''[[Melody Rules]]'' (widely regarded as a poor programme, being described as "cringeworthy"). He grew up on 9 Albion Street, [[Hawera]] in North Island of New Zealand. ===Move to Australia=== In 1995, Brough moved to Australia, where he worked on ''[[Kath & Kim (Australian TV series)|Kath & Kim]]'' as well as in films including ''[[The Craic]]'', ''[[The Nugget]]'' and ''[[Bad Eggs]]''. He also appeared on a national radio show on [[Triple M]] called ''[[Tough Love with Mick Molloy]]'' and [[Robyn Butler]]. He is best known for his role as a team captain on ''[[Spicks and Specks (TV series)|Spicks and Specks]]''. In 2006, he co-hosted ''Sammy, Subby and Alan for breakfast'' on [[Mix 106.5]] Sydney alongside Sammy Power and [[Subby Valentine]]. He resigned at the end of 2006. In 2008, he was appointed as host of the Sunday morning program on [[774 ABC Melbourne]] and across Victoria, replacing [[Helen Razer]]. He remained in the position for three years until 2011. In July 2010, he hosted special events at the [[Melbourne Cabaret Festival]]. Brough had a supporting role in the 2012 Australian comedy ''[[Any Questions for Ben?]]'', created by [[Working Dog Productions]].{{cite web|last=Schembri|first=Jim|title=Any Questions for Ben?|url=http://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/movies/any-questions-for-ben-20120209-1rp05.html|work=Age|publisher=Fairfax |accessdate=17 February 2012|date=9 February 2012}} In 2012, Brough began performing the role of [[Baron Bomburst]] in the Australian production of ''[[Chitty Chitty Bang Bang (musical)|Chitty Chitty Bang Bang]]''. ==Personal life== Brough has been with his partner, theatrical agent Helen Townshend, since 1991. They have a daughter, Daisy, born in 2011.{{cite news|url=https://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/down-and-dirty-with-the-sound-of-music-20110404-1cyk1.html|title=Down and dirty with The Sound of Music|publisher=Sydney Morning Herald|date=5 April 2011}}{{cite news|title=Lunch with ... Alan Brough|url=https://www.theage.com.au/entertainment/tv-and-radio/lunch-with--alan-brough-20120112-1pvvz.html|publisher=The Age|date=14 January 2012}} ==References== {{Reflist|refs= {{cite web |title=That Specksial feeling | work =Sydney Morning Herald |publisher=Fairfax |date=28 May 2007 |url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/tv--radio/that-specksial-feeling/2007/05/27/1180205060767.html}} {{cite web |title=Hey, Brough | work =Sydney Morning Herald |publisher=Fairfax |date=26 February 2007 |url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/tv--radio/hey-brough/2007/02/25/1172338459290.html}} {{cite web |url=http://www.abc.net.au/tv/spicksandspecks/txt/s1530161.htm |title=Spicks and Specks About the program â€“ Alan Brough |date=1 December 2005 |publisher=ABC Television | location =Australia |accessdate=9 March 2010}} {{cite web |url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/media-publishing-industry/news/article.cfm?c_id=707&objectid=10611059&pnum=4 |title=3's company |last=Lang |first=Sarah |date=23 November 2009 |work=New Zealand Herald |publisher=APN |accessdate=9 March 2010}} {{cite web |url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/tv--radio/captain-alan-takes-his-time/2007/02/13/1171128974234.html |title=Captain Alan takes his time |last=Lallo |first=Michael |date=15 February 2007 |work=Age |publisher=Fairfax Media |accessdate=9 March 2010}} }} == External links == * {{IMDb name|id=0112643|name=Alan Brough}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Brough, Alan}} [[Category:New Zealand male television actors]] [[Category:New Zealand male film actors]] [[Category:New Zealand male comedians]] [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Hawera]] [[Category:New Zealand expatriates in Australia]]
